intro: Bridelia melanthesoides, commonly known as the African snowball, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its clustered white flowers that resemble snowballs, hence its common name. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish fruits that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks in regions with a warm climate.
